description: I haven't had any issues with it. Works good to me.
Easy on the eyes and minimal. Exactly what I was looking for.

it's the default text editor what did you expect

Minimalist GNOME text editor. There are some must have features missing like multi (line/column) edit and git repository awareness. Otherwise, a perfectly clean and smooth editor. Thare's an obvious name collision that may confuse users: "Text Editor" has been gedit's application title for ages, thus unless this is meant as a successor to replace gedit in long term, I believe a different title would be welcomed.
Simple and nice.
Very simple and practical text editor
Nice user interface and simple to use. Goodbye gedit
It looks great and work great so far. I really really like it. I just wish the text would be a lighter color.

This thing keeps opening up my previous documents, even drafts. I don't want this, I just need it to open a new document a save when I tell it to.

The current version is v41.1 as of writing this and I am using Fedora 35. I really hope this gets fixed because this looks very nice and has tons of features I'd make use of. I'll gladly change my rating to 5/5 if this gets fixed.
with c files the indentation setting does nothing. also changing dark/light from menu doesn't change it in preferences
summary: DONT CHECK SPELLING AND DONT INDENT MY C CODE WITH 2 SPACES

description: The only problem is the lack of features, but on the other hand the whole idea behind GNOME is minimalism and user friendliness. It's probably for the better that this app doesn't have coding features, as it is not a coding editor. Very polished and aesthetic.

When I see syntax highlighting I want it to be clear and colorful. The way this thing highlights html with grey, dark blue, and orange is not clear. And there's no way to change the highlighting without changing the entire theme.
summary: Default syntax highlighting and themes is...not so good

description: Best simple text editor.

I found it exceedingly hard to find an app that:
- just opened and edited plaintext files without bloat
- had reasonable defaults already set so you didn't need to fiddle with it forever
- looked/behaved sleek and modern.

This editor simply does those things and should definitely be the default for most people

A lovely simple text editor, packed with delightful little features that pleasantly surprise. The way it highlights text as you search for it, for example is the best I've ever seen.

Looks great and just feels nice to use :-)
It has a Beautiful and clean UI that matches the Gnome desktop perfectly.
just a text editor. I use it every day

I have always used CLI text editors. Ever since I installed Fedora 36 Beta and tried out this text editor, I was amazed. I now use this application more often compared to CLI alternatives like Neovim or GNU Nano.
gedit plugin its will be perfect on this
Everything works, clean and simple
please add status bar like the gedit. good overall
It's a text editor, lets yah open your text documents and edit them and it does it pretty well.

in fedora 36 with (under X) i get some weird bugs where i cannot move the window sometimes and it gets like 10px dark borders. then when I switch to another keyboard - text editor doesnt pick it up and i cannot type in another language - its still defaults to english.
summary: for me - it had bugs in fedora 36

description: love the ui design, but i need the extension like gedit
Does everything a text editor needs to do and more with a clean simple interface.
It's a good editor for my admittedly light needs but it could do with an unsaved changes indicator so I now to save and don't lose work in the event of any catastrophic failure or power loss.
It's kinda slow and I couldn't put in the effort of searching for line number settings so it didnt feel intuitive. Uninstalled for gedit.
summary: A pretty neat pretty text editor..

description: Epic! Way better than gedit becuase it supports dark mode
This is something that i was looking for, very simple and lightweight, better than gedit and kwrite . Great user interface and smooth
Clean just like gedit but no option to globully disable spellcheck.
Has just enough features to be functional, but simple enough to be elegant
launches quicker than vscode, and useful for smaller edits.

If this editor had the ability to show line and column numbers, like gedit's status line, it would a full 5-star replacement. Unfortunately it's impossible to turn those on, the setting doesn't exist for this little editor, so can't use it. A shame, because I love the appearance, and how lightweight it feels otherwise.
summary: Really nice looking, missing one big feature

description: Kwrite > Text Editor

I've so many reasons to recommend this app.
* easy to use
* ui is simple
* low memory footprint
* I love it

Only thing I miss is my Dracula color theme. 
Contrary to a previous viewer, you can indeed turn on line and column numbers. Top bar to the right.

With no way to recover short of uninstalling

No thanks

Some of the most basic feature, one would expect from a text editor is missing like making text bold, underlining text, creating list, etc.
It more like 'just text' rather than 'text EDITOR'.
nice text editor
I like it better than gedit. It is a great little text editor. A little buggy as of v43, but I can wait it out while the bugs are fixed.
Not really a fan, i prefer pluma as it's much better, even looks better

The essential text editor. No extensions, no integrated terminal, just the text editor and its essential stuff. I just like how it perfectly fits with the GNOME's theme. At the moment, I have been using this text editor for over a week, and I have experienced some weird performance issues. Sincerely, it's not the best text editor and I don't really see any reason why I would recommend it over the top options, but it's fine as the default editor. If you're a user who lives fine working with default stuff, you won't complain about this software.
Open a 0.5Mb text file and search for text: type in 3 letters, and now wait 5 seconds to get you text typed in. Ridiculous.

Absolutely replace Gedit! Auto backup and restore setting is great! 

Currently doesn't need Notepad++ with wine, just use this!
summary: BEST: Text editor instead of wine Notepad++

description: I like the app style

I do not understand how it became default editor of GNOME

The application is buggy
there were problems with choosing fonts (fixed now);
it is not clear how tabs work: you select C language set tabs to 4 spaces and yet get only 2 spaces per tab.

And I understand it takes time to fix all the bugs, but how it became part of default instalation and only editor of GNOME, that is miracle to me.

It's just unintutive and buggy at times. I'm really disapointed with such decision.
summary: I do not understand how it became default editor of GNOME

description: Incredible feat of simplicity.GET OUTTA HERE WITH YOUR PRE-THEMED APP! Let MY GTK theme decide what MY text editor looks like.
summary: Great, fantastic, one thing keeps it from being any good

description: A lovely text editor for basic tasks. Use Gnome Builder if you need more.
Works as a basic text editor.
Trying to open .onx results in high background CPU usage, even though app was closed.

Tried to open file of about 20MB. Text Editor was frozen for extremely long period. I need to force close it but after re-launch, same issue! I had to delete file from tmp directory in order to be able to use software again. Realy frustrating and disapointing.
summary: Good for small files, unusable for a big ones

description: but it misses an automaticaly closing brackets feature unfortunately
I can not read the small text?

After messing arounf with pdfs trying to add text and getting fristrated I found this!! Easy to use , direct to the point!!

thanks
Minimalistic pretty editor working fine

Generally looks good and works well. One peeve is that it doesn't fully support Markdown --- bold and italic yes, but doesn't display ~~strikethrough~~, and the indentation could use some work. Kwrite is my Markdown go-to, for this reason.

I accidentally clicked a 200 MB ffmpeg log file and it was opened in Text Editor, which caused the program to hang.
Since Text Editor always loads in previously opened text files when it starts, it will just hang with one thread pegged to 100% every time it is opened.
Now I can't use Text Editor until I reinstall my OS.
Even if you close it and open it again, it automatically loads previous files
summary: When you open a very big file, the editor is useless and broken

description: I noticed a problem, if you copy the code from the editor, then it is not inserted into the DBeaver editor
does what it says on the box

I've loved using the GNOME Text Editor. It offers theme selection and customization (including dark theme), syntax highlighting for dozens of file types, a mini-map on the right sidebar showing the part of the overall document currently visible in the window, and user-customizable settings. It even has spell check and correction. This is a fantastic app and I've really enjoyed using it. Previously, I would use VS Code for all my work on source code files, but now I'm working with Markdown files in GNOME Text Editor because it is faster and very simple but still very beautiful. I commonly write in Markdown files that are about 1MB of text, and VS Code would use a lot of system resources to continuously analyze a text file that large, which created lags in performance. In contract, GNOME Text Editor handles the same files with instantaneous responsiveness, making it great for my needs.
summary: Fantastic, fast, beautiful, and simple to use

description:
When oppening bigger text/log files like Preferences file of G Chrome, it utilizes 100% of one core, then jumps to another core and so on. 

Clean Fedora 39 installation with nvidia 550 drivers and X11, latest Gnome 45.X

Copy/Paste working randomly. Sometimes to make it woks I need to first save the file I'm working on, but sometimes it doesn't help. Undo is not working most of the times too. 
Fedora 39
Gnome 45
summary: Copy/paste not working at it should

description: Why does standard mode search without regular expressions not work correctly with double backslashes //? You have to enter three of them to escape one ///

sehr schöner Editor, allerdings finde ich es nicht so toll, dass dieser Editor über das Dokumentende hinaus scollen kann, abstellen kann man dieses Verhalten leider nicht. Ebenso wäre es wünschenswert, wenn Leerzeichen und Tabs im Dokument angezeigt werden könnten und wenn es eine Option geben würde, beim Editieren von Texten (Code) automatisch beim speichern der Datei am Ende ein Leerzeichen eingefügt werden würde, also eine ähnliche Option wie bei KWrite. Ebenso wäre es schön, wenn automatisch Klammerpaare farblich markiert würden und man Klammerpaare automatisch schließen lassen könnte (als Option ähnlich wie KWrite). Leider kann warum auch immer, KWrite nicht den kompletten Text in die Zwischenablage kopieren, sondern nur einen Bruchteil davon, das können andere Editoren deutlich besser.
summary: sehr schöner Editor, allerdings noch etwas Ausbaufähig

description: no recomendado se cierra solo

Prácticamente idéntico a gedit, lo único que hecho en falta es el botón de guardar que este tenía justo encima del texto. La opción se puede usar con control + S o desde un menú desplegable pero no es tan directo como el botón que había antes. Por favor pongan una opción para habilitar este. Gracias.

No tiene el botón guardar. Me parece imprescindible.
Para lanzarlo desde la terminal "gedit" era muy sencillo, "gnome-text-editor" uff.
He acabdo desinstalandolo con synaptic, aunque la aplicación de Software de gnome, sigue diciendo que está instalada, y desde la aplicación no puede desinstalarse.
Agradecer el esfuerzo que hacen todos los programadores, y disculpen la crítica.
Por alguna razón cuando copio texto e intento pegarla en apps gtk3 como spring tool suite, dbeaver o eclipse no funciona, si funciona cuando lo hago con apps gtk4, es por eso que me cambio a gedit.

Глючное д..мо. Если строк больше 100, может зависнуть наглухо. Как процесс называется чтобы вырубить не понятно. Только перезагрузка. Каждый раз открывает все, что когда либо открывал. Хуже только Либерофис. Форматирование текста?? Не не слышали. Вобщем: дешевая рыбка - вонючая юшка

Дизайн полностью подходит всем канонам libadwaita, но к сожалению взамен на отсутствие базовых вещей, как выбор проверки орфографии для нескольких языков и невозможность безкостыльно вернуть вкладку файла после отсоединения в отдельное окно. В остальном прога даже обходит стандартный блокнот в Windows 11.
